think_procedure: First, identify the function of the 'cpu_operator_cost' knob within PostgreSQL. This knob is used to set the cost of CPU operation in terms of cost units. It does not have documented special values that change the behavior of the system in a non-linear or non-sequential way, such as disabling a feature entirely or switching modes of operation. Next, consult the PostgreSQL documentation or source to confirm if there are any undocumented special values. Assuming no special values are found, classify the knob based on its behavior as either regular or special.
